item.title: Creating IP Address Tools From Scratch
item.description: Recently I’ve been researching how the Internet is organized, and working with whois data. I’ve been creating simple tools that process IP addresses without any help from CPAN. At work we tend to use Net::IP::XS for these tasks, but sometimes it’s fun to figure out how things work under the hood. Converting to decimal I’m sure you’re familiar with the IPv4 address format; the “dotted quad” consists of four numbers between 0 and 255 separated by periods.
